intro: Corallodendron reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined coral tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets and produces showy, orange to yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
